Ed, 

- are you able to reproduce this or was this just once? 
- is it possible that the document was somehow concurrently modified?

I assume the latter - normal text documents are not thread safe (as opposed to
PartiallySychronizedDocuments); if anything modified the document while the
first change was still going on, the line tracker gets screwed.

So far it's only happened once. I don't believe anything else was modifying 
this file (it was a local file in my playpen) but I suppose it's possible.

I just got another one on the same kind of file, this time doing a 
find/replace operation. Here's the traceback:

Comment 3 shows the same problem as described in bug 56091: the document is
being changed while the DocumentLineDiffer thread tries to *read* it.
AbstractDocument is not threadsafe and cannot handle this - I will add
ConcurrentModificationException to the list in createCopy, which will simply try
again.

Comment 0 however points to the document being *changed* in a background thread,
since the the exception occurs in the UI thread (documentChanged call).

After discussion with Kai, we found the following: the reference providers (both
CVS and LastSave, at least) update the reference documents from background
threads, which causes access to the reference document to fail. Since this is
expected, DocumentLineDiffer::documentChanged handles this situation and
reinitializes the diff state. This is why the trace in comment 0 is only
warning, logged by the differ.

So, the problem is really solved: we back out and reinit if we get concurrent
updates to the reference document, which is not a frequent case. The UI polish
fix is to convert the warning into a DEBUG trace option.
